doc.title: PFTOOLS
doc.reference: Bucher P, Karplus K, Moeri N and Hofmann, K. (1996). A flexible motif search technique based on generalized profiles. Comput. Chem. 20:3-24.

interface.label:
PFTOOLS program?
pfscan: scan a sequence with a profile db pfsearch: search a sequence db for segments matching a profile
pfscan compares a protein or nucleic acid sequence against a profile library (default: Prosite).
pfsearch compares a query profile against a DNA or protein sequence library.
The result is an unsorted list of profile-sequence matches written to the standard output.

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This DNA or protein sequence will be used to search for matches to a library of PROSITE profiles.

xhtml:div.label:
Scan PROSITE db??
Yes No
Prosite library

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This file should contain one or several PROSITE profiles, against which the query sequence will be matched. Each entry in this library should be separated from the next by a line containing only the code.

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The PROSITE profile contained in this file will be used to search for profile to sequence matches in a biological sequence library.

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label:
Library of DNA or protein sequences??
Choose type of library User library Protein DNA
The program pfsearch tries to identify matches between the input profile and all individual sequences of this library.

(bat) Chlorocebus sabaeus (green monkey) Equus caballus (horse) Felis catus (cat) Homo sapiens Human v19 Mus musculus (Mouse v9) Mus musculus (Mouse v10) Sus scrofa pig 16S RNA genes database RNA Database Project

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: Reformat PSA result file to Fasta multiple sequence alignment file? Yes No

Cut-off level to be used for match selection (-C)?
The value should be the numerical identifier of a cut-off level defined in the profile. The raw or normalized score of this level will then be used to include profile to sequence matches in the output list. If the specified level does not exist in the profile, the next higher (if cut_off is negative) or next lower (if cut_off is positive) level defined is used instead.

Normalization mode to use for score (-M)?
The value specifies which normalization mode defined in the profile should be used to compute the normalized scores for profile to sequence matches. This option will override the profile's PRIORITY parameter. If the specified normalization mode does not exist in the profile, an error message will be output to standard error and the search is interrupted.
Search the complementary strands of DNA sequences as well (-b) Yes No
Use raw scores rather than normalized scores for match selection. Normalized scores will not be listed in the output. (-r) Yes No
Forces DISJOINT=UNIQUE (-u) Yes No

Report optimal alignment scores for all sequences regardless of the cut-off value (-a)? ?
Yes No
This option simultaneously forces DISJOINT=UNIQUE.

Report individual matches for circular profiles (-m)? ?
Yes No
If the profile is circular, each match between a sequence and a profile can be composed of a stretch of individual matches of the profile. By default, pfscan reports only the total matched region. When this option is set, detailed information for each individual match will be output as well.
Indicate the value of the highest cut-off level exceeded by the match score (-l)? Yes No

Indicate by character string of the highest cut-off level exceeded by the match score (-L)? ?
Yes No
The generalized profile format includes a text string field to specify a name for a cut-off level. The -L option causes the program to display the first two characters of this text string (usually something like !, ?, ??, etc.) at the beginning of each match description.

Limit profile description length (-d)? ?
Yes No
If this option is set, the description of the profile on the header line will be limited in length. If the match information is longer than the output width specified using option -W, the profile description will not be printed. Else the description will be truncated to fit the -W value.
By default, the profile description is not truncated. This option can not be used when option -k is set.

xpsa headers for output (-k)? ?
Yes No
When this option is set, all output type will use an xpsa style header line.
This format uses keyword=value pairs to output alignment parameters. It is useful to transfer information between different sequence alignment tools.
List the sequences of the matched regions as well. The output will be a Pearson/Fasta-formatted sequence library. (-s) Yes No
List profile-sequence alignments in pftools PSA format. (-x) Yes No
Display alignments between the profile and the matched sequence regions in a human-friendly format. (-y) Yes No

Indicate starting and ending position of the matched profile range. (-z) ?
Yes No
The latter position will be given as a negative offset from the end of the profile. Thus the range [1,-1] means entire profile.

Set alignment output width (-W) ?
The value specifies how many residues will be output on one line when any of the -s, -x or -y options is set.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: pfscan compares a protein or nucleic acid sequence against a profile library (default: Prosite).
pfsearch compares a query profile against a DNA or protein sequence library.
The result is an unsorted list of profile-sequence matches written to the standard output.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This DNA or protein sequence will be used to search for matches to a library of PROSITE profiles.
Prosite library

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This file should contain one or several PROSITE profiles, against which the query sequence will be matched. Each entry in this library should be separated from the next by a line containing only the code.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The PROSITE profile contained in this file will be used to search for profile to sequence matches in a biological sequence library.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The program pfsearch tries to identify matches between the input profile and all individual sequences of this library.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.
This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.
This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The value should be the numerical identifier of a cut-off level defined in the profile. The raw or normalized score of this level will then be used to include profile to sequence matches in the output list. If the specified level does not exist in the profile, the next higher (if cut_off is negative) or next lower (if cut_off is positive) level defined is used instead.

The value specifies which normalization mode defined in the profile should be used to compute the normalized scores for profile to sequence matches. This option will override the profile's PRIORITY parameter. If the specified normalization mode does not exist in the profile, an error message will be output to standard error and the search is interrupted.
This option simultaneously forces DISJOINT=UNIQUE.

If the profile is circular, each match between a sequence and a profile can be composed of a stretch of individual matches of the profile. By default, pfscan reports only the total matched region. When this option is set, detailed information for each individual match will be output as well.

The generalized profile format includes a text string field to specify a name for a cut-off level. The -L option causes the program to display the first two characters of this text string (usually something like !, ?, ??, etc.) at the beginning of each match description.

If this option is set, the description of the profile on the header line will be limited in length. If the match information is longer than the output width specified using option -W, the profile description will not be printed. Else the description will be truncated to fit the -W value.
By default, the profile description is not truncated. This option can not be used when option -k is set.
When this option is set, all output type will use an xpsa style header line.
This format uses keyword=value pairs to output alignment parameters. It is useful to transfer information between different sequence alignment tools.
The latter position will be given as a negative offset from the end of the profile. Thus the range [1,-1] means entire profile.
The value specifies how many residues will be output on one line when any of the -s, -x or -y options is set.

parameter.name: aa_or_nuc_db
parameter.prompt: Library of DNA or protein sequences?

message.text: You must either choose a protein, a nucleotid or a user library

ctrl.code: ($aa_or_nuc_db eq "protein" and $aadb ne "null") or ( $aa_or_nuc_db eq "user" and defined $userdb) or ($aa_or_nuc_db eq "dna" and $nucdb ne "null")
(aa_or_nuc_db == "protein" and aadb != "null") or (aa_or_nuc_db == "user" and userdb is not None) or (aa_or_nuc_db == "dna" and nucdb != "null")

comment.text: The program pfsearch tries to identify matches between the input profile and all individual sequences of this library.

Choose type of library User library Protein DNA
The program pfsearch tries to identify matches between the input profile and all individual sequences of this library.

parameter.name: psa2msa
parameter.prompt: Reformat PSA result file to Fasta multiple sequence alignment file?

parameter.name: cutoff
parameter.prompt: Cut-off level to be used for match selection (-C)

format.code: ("" , " -C " + str(value))[ value is not None and value != vdef]

comment.text: The value should be the numerical identifier of a cut-off level defined in the profile. The raw or normalized score of this level will then be used to include profile to sequence matches in the output list. If the specified level does not exist in the profile, the next higher (if cut_off is negative) or next lower (if cut_off is positive) level defined is used instead.

interface.label:
Cut-off level to be used for match selection (-C)?
The value should be the numerical identifier of a cut-off level defined in the profile. The raw or normalized score of this level will then be used to include profile to sequence matches in the output list. If the specified level does not exist in the profile, the next higher (if cut_off is negative) or next lower (if cut_off is positive) level defined is used instead.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.prompt: Normalization mode to use for score (-M)

comment.text: The value specifies which normalization mode defined in the profile should be used to compute the normalized scores for profile to sequence matches. This option will override the profile's PRIORITY parameter. If the specified normalization mode does not exist in the profile, an error message will be output to standard error and the search is interrupted.

interface.label:
Normalization mode to use for score (-M)?
The value specifies which normalization mode defined in the profile should be used to compute the normalized scores for profile to sequence matches. This option will override the profile's PRIORITY parameter. If the specified normalization mode does not exist in the profile, an error message will be output to standard error and the search is interrupted.

This option will override the profile's PRIORITY parameter. If the specified normalization mode does not exist in the profile, an error message will be output to standard error and the search is interrupted.

parameter.name: compl
parameter.prompt: Search the complementary strands of DNA sequences as well (-b)

interface.label: Search the complementary strands of DNA sequences as well (-b) Yes No

parameter.name: raw_score
parameter.prompt: Use raw scores rather than normalized scores for match selection. Normalized scores will not be listed in the output. (-r)

interface.label: Use raw scores rather than normalized scores for match selection. Normalized scores will not be listed in the output. (-r) Yes No

parameter.name: unique
parameter.prompt: Forces DISJOINT=UNIQUE (-u)

interface.label: Forces DISJOINT=UNIQUE (-u) Yes No

parameter.name: optimal
parameter.prompt: Report optimal alignment scores for all sequences regardless of the cut-off value (-a)?

interface.label:
Report optimal alignment scores for all sequences regardless of the cut-off value (-a)? ?
Yes No
This option simultaneously forces DISJOINT=UNIQUE.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This option simultaneously forces DISJOINT=UNIQUE.

parameter.name: individual_match
parameter.prompt: Report individual matches for circular profiles (-m)?

comment.text: If the profile is circular, each match between a sequence and a profile can be composed of a stretch of individual matches of the profile. By default, pfscan reports only the total matched region. When this option is set, detailed information for each individual match will be output as well.

interface.label:
Report individual matches for circular profiles (-m)? ?
Yes No
If the profile is circular, each match between a sequence and a profile can be composed of a stretch of individual matches of the profile. By default, pfscan reports only the total matched region. When this option is set, detailed information for each individual match will be output as well.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: If the profile is circular, each match between a sequence and a profile can be composed of a stretch of individual matches of the profile. By default, pfscan reports only the total matched region. When this option is set, detailed information for each individual match will be output as well.

parameter.name: value_hightest_cut_off
parameter.prompt: Indicate the value of the highest cut-off level exceeded by the match score (-l)?

interface.label: Indicate the value of the highest cut-off level exceeded by the match score (-l)? Yes No

parameter.name: char_hightest_cut_off
parameter.prompt: Indicate by character string of the highest cut-off level exceeded by the match score (-L)?

comment.text: The generalized profile format includes a text string field to specify a name for a cut-off level. The -L option causes the program to display the first two characters of this text string (usually something like !, ?, ??, etc.) at the beginning of each match description.

interface.label:
Indicate by character string of the highest cut-off level exceeded by the match score (-L)? ?
Yes No
The generalized profile format includes a text string field to specify a name for a cut-off level. The -L option causes the program to display the first two characters of this text string (usually something like !, ?, ??, etc.) at the beginning of each match description.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The generalized profile format includes a text string field to specify a name for a cut-off level. The -L option causes the program to display the first two characters of this text string (usually something like !, ?, ??, etc.) at the beginning of each match description.

parameter.name: Length
parameter.prompt: Limit profile description length (-d)?

comment.text: If this option is set, the description of the profile on the header line will be limited in length. If the match information is longer than the output width specified using option -W, the profile description will not be printed. Else the description will be truncated to fit the -W value.
By default, the profile description is not truncated. This option can not be used when option -k is set.

interface.label:
Limit profile description length (-d)? ?
Yes No
If this option is set, the description of the profile on the header line will be limited in length. If the match information is longer than the output width specified using option -W, the profile description will not be printed. Else the description will be truncated to fit the -W value.
By default, the profile description is not truncated. This option can not be used when option -k is set.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: If this option is set, the description of the profile on the header line will be limited in length. If the match information is longer than the output width specified using option -W, the profile description will not be printed. Else the description will be truncated to fit the -W value.
By default, the profile description is not truncated. This option can not be used when option -k is set.

parameter.name: xpsa
parameter.prompt: xpsa headers for output (-k)?

comment.text: When this option is set, all output type will use an xpsa style header line.
This format uses keyword=value pairs to output alignment parameters. It is useful to transfer information between different sequence alignment tools.

interface.label:
xpsa headers for output (-k)? ?
Yes No
When this option is set, all output type will use an xpsa style header line.
This format uses keyword=value pairs to output alignment parameters. It is useful to transfer information between different sequence alignment tools.

This format uses keyword=value pairs to output alignment parameters. It is useful to transfer information between different sequence alignment tools.

parameter.name: listseq

Yes No

format.code: ("" , " -W "+str(value))[value is not None and value != vdef]
